title: Seattle pet name and distribution
text: purpose seattlepetname package allows users understand preference primary breeds pet names pet owners Seattle. package also allows users retrieve distribution licensed pet Seattle according zip code districts. distribution licensed pet different zip code districts show whether particular district deal habitat particular primary breed. preference pet name allow user decide unique name pets.

title: Seattle pet name and distribution
text: People living Seattle wants pet.

title: Seattle pet name and distribution
text: data used package record Seattle licensed pet 2003 2018. author data set City Seattle.

title: Seattle pet name and distribution
text: preference primary breeds pet owners Seattle entering primary breeds max_pribreed() function, data frame 5 zip code districts highest number particular primary breed returned. Users can check name primary breed data set. following example used “Old English Sheepdog” demonstration. data frame allow users understand particular primary breed preferred pet owners particular zip code district. implies district suitable particular primary breed. Users enter input character string. input case-sensitive, example create error entering “dog” instead “Dog”. zip code highest number licensed pets particular year entering year zipcode_max() function, data frame zip code districts highest number licensed pets overall returned. following example used year 2018 demonstration. data frame allows users understand distribution licensed pet zip code district Seattle years. district highest number licensed pet may facilities pets. *range year 2015 2018, record years prior 2015 less 20 observations. *Users enter input character string. zip code lowest number licensed pets particular year entering year zipcode_min() function, data frame zip code districts lowest number licensed pets overall. following example used year 2018 demonstration. data frame allows users understand distribution licensed pet zip code district Seattle years. *range year 2015 2018, record years prior 2015 less 20 observations. *Users enter input character string. top 5 pet name particular year entering pet names year name_of_the_year() function, data frame top 5 popular names respective count particular year returned. name top 5 list, character string “popular name year!” returned indicate name popular. name top 5 list, data frame mentioned character string “popular name year!”. data frame allows users understand trend pet name Seattle. range year 2015 2018, record years prior 2015 less 20 observations. Users enter input character string. input case-sensitive, example create error entering “dog” instead “Dog”. number summary pet distribution year entering year pet_summary() function, data frame mean, median, standard deviation number zip code recorded particular year returned. number summary based number districts recorded particular year. data frame allow users understand trend distribution pet Seattle. range year 2015 2018, record years prior 2015 less 20 observations. Users enter input character string. top 10 popular pet name (species) Seattle entering species top_name() function, plot shows top 10 popular name particular species returned . data frame allow users understand preference pet names (species) pet owners Seattle. Users enter input character string. input case-sensitive, example create error entering “dog” instead “Dog”. utilize function ggplot2 dplyr: Using pet_summary() example, functions package facilitates data analysis process. Users can compare data different year utilizing different packages create meaningful plots.
code: max_pribreed("Old English Sheepdog") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   zip_code count #>      <int> <int> #> 1    98115     7 #> 2    98118     7 #> 3    98105     6 #> 4    98199     6 #> 5    98136     5 zipcode_max("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> # Groups:   year [1] #>    year zip_code     n #>   <dbl>    <int> <int> #> 1  2018    98115  2944 zipcode_min("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> # Groups:   year [1] #>    year zip_code     n #>   <dbl>    <int> <int> #> 1  2018     9811     1 name_of_the_year("Silas", "2018") # When the name is not on the top 5 list #> [1] "This is not a popular name of this year!" name_of_the_year("Lucy", "2018") #When the name is on the top 5 list #> [1] "This is a popular name of this year!" #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   year, animals_name [5] #>    year animals_name     n #>   <dbl> <chr>        <int> #> 1  2018 Lucy           271 #> 2  2018 Charlie        245 #> 3  2018 Luna           238 #> 4  2018 Bella          207 #> 5  2018 Max            176 pet_summary("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>    year  mean median    sd zipcode_count #>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>         <int> #> 1  2018  361.    2.5  679.            92 top_name("Dog") summary_2016 <- pet_summary("2016")  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>    year  mean median    sd zipcode_count #>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>         <int> #> 1  2016  47.6     49  39.2            33  summary_2017 <- pet_summary("2017")  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>    year  mean median    sd zipcode_count #>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>         <int> #> 1  2017  265.      4  399.            64  summary_2018 <- pet_summary("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>    year  mean median    sd zipcode_count #>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>         <int> #> 1  2018  361.    2.5  679.            92  summary <- full_join(summary_2016, summary_2017)  #> Joining, by = c("year", "mean", "median", "sd", "zipcode_count")  summary <- full_join(summary, summary_2018) %>%   select(year, zipcode_count)  #> Joining, by = c("year", "mean", "median", "sd", "zipcode_count")   ggplot(summary, aes(x = as.factor(year), y = zipcode_count)) +   geom_col()

what: The Distribution of Pets Across Seattle
title: The Distribution of Pets Across Seattle
text: goal seattlepetname allows users understand preference primary breeds pet names pet owners Seattle. package also allows users retrieve distribution licensed pet Seattle according zip code districts.

title: The Distribution of Pets Across Seattle
text: Users can install seattlepetname GitHub :

title: The Distribution of Pets Across Seattle
text: example use functions: preference primary breeds pet owners Seattle entering primary breeds max_pribreed() function, data frame 5 zip code districts highest number particular primary breed returned. zip code highest number licensed pets particular year entering year zipcode_max() function, data frame zip code districts highest number licensed pets overall. following example used year 2018 demonstration. zip code lowest number licensed pets particular year entering year zipcode_min() function, data frame zip code districts lowest number licensed pets overall. top 5 pet name particular year entering pet names year name_of_the_year() function, data frame top 5 popular names respective count particular year returned. number summary pet distribution year entering year pet_summary() function, data frame mean, median, standard deviation number zip code recorded particular year returned. top 10 popular pet name (species) Seattle entering species top_name() function, plot shows top 10 popular name particular species returned.
code: library(seattlepetname) max_pribreed("Old English Sheepdog") #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   zip_code count #>      <int> <int> #> 1    98115     7 #> 2    98118     7 #> 3    98105     6 #> 4    98199     6 #> 5    98136     5 zipcode_max("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> # Groups:   year [1] #>    year zip_code     n #>   <dbl>    <int> <int> #> 1  2018    98115  2944 zipcode_min("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> # Groups:   year [1] #>    year zip_code     n #>   <dbl>    <int> <int> #> 1  2018     9811     1 name_of_the_year("Silas", "2018") #When the name is not on the top 5 list #> [1] "This is not a popular name of this year!" name_of_the_year("Lucy", "2018") #When the name is on the top 5 list #> [1] "This is a popular name of this year!" #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   year, animals_name [5] #>    year animals_name     n #>   <dbl> <chr>        <int> #> 1  2018 Lucy           271 #> 2  2018 Charlie        245 #> 3  2018 Luna           238 #> 4  2018 Bella          207 #> 5  2018 Max            176 pet_summary("2018") #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>    year  mean median    sd zipcode_count #>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>         <int> #> 1  2018  361.    2.5  679.            92 top_name("Dog")
